definition: to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)

sentences.english: Nothing can keep us from walking off the livelong night.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼能阻攔我們走出這漫漫長夜。

sentences.english: Though I was yet a mere child my father did not place any restriction on my wanderings.
sentences.chinese: 那時我還是個孩子，父親對我的走動，從不橫加阻攔。

sentences.english: But I didn't let that daunt me.
Clear natural, anti-impact, affectively stopping ultraviolet radiation, scattered light.
sentences.chinese: 清晰自然，抗衝擊，有效阻攔紫外線，眩光及散射光。

sentences.english: Even a mighty express train can be held up by signals.
sentences.chinese: 即使特別快車也能被信號阻攔。

sentences.english: And of course nothing can stand in your way as long as you’re taking decisive action.
sentences.chinese: 當然，只要你果決行動，什麼都不能阻攔你。

sentences.english: These examples are meant to caution you, not to deter you.
sentences.chinese: 這些例子是要你警醒，而非阻攔你。

sentences.english: Dogs and black woman rushed to night, to stop the black ant.
sentences.chinese: 夜犬和黑婆聞訊趕來，想阻攔黑蟻。

sentences.english: Wood, pointed a gun at the flower perianth dong-qing li.
sentences.chinese: 柴團長拿槍指着花花被李冬青阻攔。

sentences.english: Nobody can keep me back from taking the job.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人能阻攔我接受這項工作。

sentences.english: It's yet another impediment to anyone investing in infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 這對投資基礎設施的人是一個新的阻攔。

sentences.english: General Kim replied, “We will attack the nuclear base to interrupt the nuclear assault.”
sentences.chinese: 金泰榮答道“我們將進攻核基地以阻攔核攻擊。”
他一個箭步衝了出去，連002都無法阻攔。

sentences.english: Bryan was enjoying running around the park without interruption from us.
sentences.chinese: 小小貝在公園裏撒歡地跑着，沒人阻攔。

sentences.english: WangXiaoGong stop not, can only look at the patient one million hu.
sentences.chinese: 王小紅阻攔不了，只能看着胡百萬把那些病人帶走。

sentences.english: Participated in the contest, the Hong Xiuhuan also been blocked.
sentences.chinese: 參加此次大賽時，洪秀煥也進行了阻攔。

definition: to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to turn a blind eye to
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
